original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

"If you prize wisdom, she will exalt you. Embrace her and she will

honor you." (Pro. 4:8)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We are victorious by believing in Christ, persevering, remaining

faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings

GREAT REWARDS. (Rev. 21:7)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord, for what Christ did for us on the cross and what
really

happened when He rose for the dead. What we need to remember is that

He conquered the grave, death, and Satan. This victory can also be
ours

by believing, persevering, and remaining faithful to Christ. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: We are victorious by believing in Christ, persevering, remaining faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings GREAT REWARDS. (Revelation 21:7)
original_verse_text: "If you prize wisdom, she will exalt you. Embrace her and she will honor you. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking Your strength and guidance as we navigate the spiritual battles we face. Grant us the wisdom and discernment to recognize the schemes of the enemy and the courage to stand firm in our faith, clinging to the promise of victory that is ours through Christ. May we persevere in righteousness, living as those who follow You, that we may receive the great rewards You have prepared for us. In Your mighty name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: We are victorious by believing in Christ, persevering, remaining faithful, and living as one who follows Christ. Such a life brings great rewards. (Revelation 21:7)
subject: Victorious Life in Christ
verse_text: “If you prize wisdom, she will exalt you. Embrace her and she will honor you. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Do not do as the wicked do or follow the path of evildoers._

_Avoid their haunts, turn away and go somewhere else._

(Pro. 4:13, 14)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

While we should be accepting of others, we need a healthy

skepticism about human behavior. When you feel yourself

being heavily influenced proceed with caution. The oLD

SAYING is: "do not do anything in the daytime, that will

keep you awake at night.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would

keep me on the straight and narrow, the path of Your will.

AMEN.
original_reflection_text: While we should be accepting of others, we need a healthy skepticism about human behavior. When you feel yourself being heavily influenced proceed with caution. The oLD SAYING is: "do not do anything in the daytime, that will keep you awake at night.
original_verse_text: "Do not do as the wicked do or follow the path of evildoers. Avoid their haunts, turn away and go somewhere else.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and discernment. Help us to walk carefully, not as unwise but as wise, making the most of every opportunity (Ephesians 5:15-16). Grant us the strength to hold fast to Your instructions, not turning to the right or to the left (Proverbs 4:13, 14). May we have the courage to proceed with caution when we feel ourselves being heavily influenced, that our actions may always bring honor to Your name. Amen.
reflection: While we should be accepting of others, we need a healthy skepticism about human behavior. When you feel yourself being heavily influenced, proceed with caution. The old saying is: “Do not do anything in the daytime that will keep you awake at night.“
subject: Healthy Skepticism Amid Influence
verse_text: “Do not do as the wicked do or follow the path of evildoers. Avoid their haunts, turn away and go somewhere else.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The way of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn,_

_which shines ever brighter until full light of day." _(Pro.4:18)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The wicked are NOT so, the wicked are like the darkest night.

The righteous follow the light of God's Word. and they allow

God's Word to penetrate deep into their heart.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance,

so that Your holy Word would enlighten my every thought.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: The wicked are NOT so, the wicked are like the darkest night. The righteous follow the light of God's Word. and they allow God's Word to penetrate deep into their heart.
original_verse_text: "The way of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, which shines ever brighter until full light of day. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the light of Your Word that guides our steps and illuminates the path of righteousness. Help us to walk in the light, allowing Your truth to penetrate our hearts and transform our lives. May we ever follow the light of Your Word, turning away from the darkness of the wicked. We trust in Your perfect plan and desire to live according to Your will. Amen.
reflection: The wicked are not so; the wicked are like the darkest night. The righteous follow the light of God's Word, and they allow God's Word to penetrate deep into their hearts.
subject: Righteous Follow God's Light
verse_text: “The way of the righteous is like the first gleam of dawn, which shines ever brighter until full light of day. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Above all else, guard your heart, for it affects everything you
do._

_Avoid all perverse talk; stay far from corrupt speech." _(Pro. 4:23,
24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Jesus reminds us in Luke 6:45 THAT our speech and actions reveals

the true underlying beliefs, attitudes, and motivations. The good

impressions we try to make cannot last IF our heart is deceptive.

What is in our heart will come out in our speech and behavior.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of grace and mercy, I pray that You will forgive me when

my speech and attitude are not pleasing to You. I pray that I would

be sensitive to Your Holy Spirit's guidance. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Jesus reminds us in Luke 6:45 THAT our speech and actions reveals the true underlying beliefs, attitudes, and motivations. The good impressions we try to make cannot last IF our heart is deceptive. What is in our heart will come out in our speech and behavior.
original_verse_text: "Above all else, guard your heart, for it affects everything you do. Avoid all perverse talk; stay far from corrupt speech. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that the words we speak and the actions we take are a reflection of the state of our inner being. Help us to guard our hearts, as Your Word in Proverbs 4 instructs, for from it flow the springs of life. May our speech and conduct be a true expression of the goodness and righteousness that You have placed within us through Your Son, Jesus Christ. Purify our hearts, Lord, that our lives may bear the fruit of Your Spirit and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: Jesus reminds us in Luke 6:45 that our speech and actions reveal the true underlying beliefs, attitudes, and motivations. The good impressions we try to make cannot last if our heart is deceptive. What is in our heart will come out in our speech and behavior.
subject: Reveal Your Heart's Treasure
verse_text: “Above all else, guard your heart, for it affects everything you do. Avoid all perverse talk; stay far from corrupt speech. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Evil people CANNOT sleep until they have done their evil _

_deed for the day. They CANNOT rest unless they have caused_

_someone to stumble." _(Pro. 4:16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A person's thoughts and plans reflect his or her character.

What do you think about as you lie down to sleep? Do

your desires involve greed or steeping on others to

achieve your goals? Evil thoughts lead to evil actions.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that You would forgive me for

any evil thoughts. I pray that You would cleanse me of any

further evil thoughts. Amen.
original_reflection_text: A person's thoughts and plans reflect his or her character. What do you think about as you lie down to sleep? Do your desires involve greed or steeping on others to achieve your goals? Evil thoughts lead to evil actions.
original_verse_text: "Evil people CANNOT sleep until they have done their evil deed for the day. They CANNOT rest unless they have caused someone to stumble. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to align our thoughts and desires with Your perfect will. Help us to guard our minds against the temptations of greed, deceit, and malice that so often plague our human nature. Grant us the wisdom to pursue righteousness, to speak truth, and to live in a manner that brings glory to Your name. May our lives reflect the goodness and integrity that You desire for Your children. We ask this in the name of Jesus Christ, our Lord. Amen.
reflection: A person's thoughts and plans reflect their character. What do you think about as you lie down to sleep? Do your desires involve greed or stepping on others to achieve your goals? Evil thoughts lead to evil actions.
subject: Reflect Your Character's Integrity
verse_text: “Evil people CANNOT sleep until they have done their evil deed for the day. They CANNOT rest unless they have caused someone to stumble. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Mark out a straight path for your feet, then stick to the path and
_

_stay safe. Don 't get side tracked, keep your feet from following
evil. _

(Pro. 4:26, 27)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

What is being implied is that we should put boundaries on our
desires.

We should not go after everything we see. We need to keep our eyes

fixed on our goal, and not get side tracked on detours that lead to
sin.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I pray that I will always remain sensitive to Your Holy

Spirit's guidance so that I would not go the way of the world. I

pray that my goal will always be to keep my eyes fixed on You.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: What is being implied is that we should put boundaries on our desires. We should not go after everything we see. We need to keep our eyes fixed on our goal, and not get side tracked on detours that lead to sin.
original_verse_text: "Mark out a straight path for your feet, then stick to the path and stay safe. Don 't get side tracked, keep your feet from following evil.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding. May our steps be directed by Your path, that we may walk uprightly and not stray to the right or to the left. Keep our eyes fixed on the goal You have set before us, that we may not be led astray by the temptations of this world. Grant us the strength to stay the course and the discernment to recognize the detours that lead to sin. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: What is being implied is that we should put boundaries on our desires. We should not go after everything we see. We need to keep our eyes fixed on our goal and not get sidetracked on detours that lead to sin.
subject: Tame Unruly Desires
verse_text: “Mark out a straight path for your feet, then stick to the path and stay safe. Don 't get side tracked, keep your feet from following evil.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my wise counsel._

_Then you will learn to be discreet and will store up knowledge."_

(Pro. 5:1, 2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to remember that sin offends our Holy God, and separates

us from Him. Because God is Holy, He cannot ignore, excuse, or

tolerate sin, as though it did not matter. Sin cuts people off from

Him. This why we need to study God's wisdom and wise counsel; (the
Bible).

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

O Lord of all knowledge, wisdom, and wise counsel, I pray that I

will never grow tired of studying Your Holy Word so that I grow

in knowledge in accordance with Your will. Amen.

_ _
original_reflection_text: We need to remember that sin offends our Holy God, and separates us from Him. Because God is Holy, He cannot ignore, excuse, or tolerate sin, as though it did not matter. Sin cuts people off from Him. This why we need to study God's wisdom and wise counsel; (the Bible).
original_verse_text: "Pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my wise counsel. Then you will learn to be discreet and will store up knowledge. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the weight of our sin and the need for Your wisdom and guidance. Your Word reminds us that true wisdom comes from You, and You alone. Help us to incline our ears to Your instruction, that we may understand the knowledge of God and find the fear of the Lord, which is the beginning of wisdom. Protect us from the ways of the wicked, and lead us in the paths of righteousness, that we may walk in Your ways and bring glory to Your name. Amen.
reflection: We need to remember that sin offends our Holy God and separates us from Him. Because God is Holy, He cannot ignore, excuse, or tolerate sin, as though it did not matter. Sin cuts people off from Him. This is why we need to study God's wisdom and wise counsel (the Bible).
subject: Pursue God's Holiness, Avoid Sin
verse_text: “Pay attention to my wisdom; listen carefully to my wise counsel. Then you will learn to be discreet and will store up knowledge. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The lips of an immoral woman are as sweet as honey and her _

_mouth is smoother then oil. But the result is as bitter as poison."_

(Pro. 5:3, 4a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The writer of proverbs is talking about a prostitute, and is warning

against illicit sex for several reasons. (first) A prostitute's charm
is

used as an example of any temptation to do wrong and leave the

pursuit of wisdom. (second) Sexual immorality of any kind was

and still is extremely dangerous. (third) Sexual immorality is

against God's law.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I pray for Your Holy Spirit's continual guidance in my life so that

I would not stray from Your law. My prayer is that I would always

remain faithful to You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The writer of proverbs is talking about a prostitute, and is warning against illicit sex for several reasons. (first) A prostitute's charm is used as an example of any temptation to do wrong and leave the pursuit of wisdom. (second) Sexual immorality of any kind was and still is extremely dangerous. (third) Sexual immorality is against God's law.
original_verse_text: "The lips of an immoral woman are as sweet as honey and her mouth is smoother then oil. But the result is as bitter as poison. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the temptations that seek to lure us away from Your wisdom and righteous ways. Help us to resist the allure of the world, for we know that the lips of an adulteress drip honey, but in the end, her ways are bitter as wormwood and sharp as a double-edged sword. Grant us the strength to remain steadfast in our pursuit of Your truth and to flee from all forms of sexual immorality, which are an affront to Your holy law. May our hearts and minds be fixed on You, the source of true and lasting fulfillment. Amen.
reflection: The writer of Proverbs is talking about a prostitute and is warning against illicit sex for several reasons. A prostitute's charm is used as an example of any temptation to do wrong and leave the pursuit of wisdom. Sexual immorality of any kind was and still is extremely dangerous. Sexual immorality is against God's law.
subject: Beware Temptation's Alluring Charm
verse_text: “The lips of an immoral woman are as sweet as honey and her mouth is smoother then oil. But the result is as bitter as poison. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"If you have co-signed a loan for a friend or guaranteed a debt _

_of someone you hardly know, if you have trapped yourself and _

_are caught by what you said, quick, get out of it if you possibly _

_can! You have placed yourself at your friend's mercy. _(Pro. 6:1,
3a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

These verses are not a plea against generosity, but against overextending one's financial resources, which could lead to your own

poverty. It is important to maintain a balance between generosity

and good stewardship. God wants us to help our friends and the

needy, but He does not promise to cover the costs of every unwise

commitment we make.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord I thank You for the wise counsel of these verses, may

I always be prudent and follow Your counsel. Amen.
original_reflection_text: These verses are not a plea against generosity, but against overextending one's financial resources, which could lead to your own poverty. It is important to maintain a balance between generosity and good stewardship. God wants us to help our friends and the needy, but He does not promise to cover the costs of every unwise commitment we make.
original_verse_text: "If you have cosigned a loan for a friend or guaranteed a debt of someone you hardly know, if you have trapped yourself and are caught by what you said, quick, get out of it if you possibly can! You have placed yourself at your friend's mercy.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking Your wisdom and guidance. Help us to be generous in spirit, yet discerning in our commitments, that we may not become entangled in the debts of others. Grant us the prudence to steward our resources wisely, while still extending a helping hand to those in need. May we walk the path of good stewardship, ever mindful of Your call to care for one another. Amen.
reflection: These verses are not a plea against generosity, but against overextending one's financial resources, which could lead to your own poverty. It is important to maintain a balance between generosity and good stewardship. God wants us to help our friends and the needy, but He does not promise to cover the costs of every unwise commitment we make.
subject: Balanced Generosity: Wise Stewardship
verse_text: “If you have cosigned a loan for a friend or guaranteed a debt of someone you hardly know, if you have trapped yourself and are caught by what you said, quick, get out of it if you possibly can! You have placed yourself at your friend's mercy.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"A LITTLE SLEEP, a LITTLE SLUMBER, and a LITTLE FOLDING of hands_

_to rest, and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and_

_want like an armed man." _(Pro. 6:10, 11)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

A little, laziness works in small increments, in lame excuses

that seek present comforts at the risk of future poverty.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would not look for excuses to avoid

having to do the tasks at hand, hopping that someone else

will do the work I should be doing. Amen.
original_reflection_text: A little, laziness works in small increments, in lame excuses that seek present comforts at the risk of future poverty.
original_verse_text: "A LITTLE SLEEP, a LITTLE SLUMBER, and a LITTLE FOLDING of hands to rest, and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and want like an armed man. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we confess that we are often tempted by the allure of laziness and the desire for immediate gratification. Help us to heed the wisdom of Your Word, which warns against the dangers of slothfulness and the ruin it brings. Grant us the discipline and diligence to steward our time and resources wisely, that we may not fall into the trap of poverty and want. May we be faithful and productive in the work You have called us to, always seeking to honor You in all we do. Amen.
reflection: A little laziness works in small increments, in lame excuses that seek present comforts at the risk of future poverty.
subject: Beware Lazy Excuses' Costly Trap
verse_text: “A LITTLE SLEEP, a LITTLE SLUMBER, and a LITTLE FOLDING of hands to rest, and poverty will come upon you like a robber, and want like an armed man. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech,_

_therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly, in a moment he will_

_be broken beyond healing." _(Pro. 6:12, 15)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Solomon labels the deceptive person as one who is good for nothing

and whose mouth is corrupt. The corrupt speech here could include

slander gossip, misrepresentation, or schemes that call for fast talk

with skilled deception. We should never play the role of a judge, we

need to leave that role up to God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I seek Your forgiveness, because it seems to be easy to

talk about other people in our conversations, which is less then

complementary. Help me to leave the role of judging up to You. .
Amen.
original_reflection_text: Solomon labels the deceptive person as one who is good for nothing and whose mouth is corrupt. The corrupt speech here could include slander gossip, misrepresentation, or schemes that call for fast talk with skilled deception. We should never play the role of a judge, we need to leave that role up to God.
original_verse_text: "A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech, therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly, in a moment he will be broken beyond healing. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, recognizing the danger of corrupt speech and the temptation to judge others. Forgive us for the times we have indulged in slander, gossip, or deceitful words, rather than speaking with wisdom and restraint. Help us to guard our tongues, that we may not stumble or bring harm to others. May we instead seek to build up and encourage one another, leaving the role of judge to You alone. We trust in Your perfect justice and mercy. Amen.
reflection: Solomon labels the deceptive person as one who is good for nothing and whose mouth is corrupt. The corrupt speech here could include slander, gossip, misrepresentation, or schemes that call for fast talk with skilled deception. We should never play the role of a judge; we need to leave that role up to God.
subject: Beware the Corrupt Tongue
verse_text: “A worthless person, a wicked man, goes about with crooked speech, therefore calamity will come upon him suddenly, in a moment he will be broken beyond healing. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"There are six things the Lord hates, no seven things He detests._

_haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that kill the innocent, and_

_that plots evil, feet that race to do wrong, a false witness who_

_pours out lies, a person who sows discord among brothers."_

(Pro. 6:16-19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

We need to note that the sin of murder is listed with other sins

more subtle and are hard to prove and punish. But we really

need to remember God hate all sin, even the ones missed or

camouflaged by humans. Another fact to remember is God

sees into the heart.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I am so thankful that even-though

You hate all sin, if we come to You in sincere repentance

You will forgive us. Amen.
original_reflection_text: We need to note that the sin of murder is listed with other sins more subtle and are hard to prove and punish. But we really need to remember God hate all sin, even the ones missed or camouflaged by humans. Another fact to remember is God sees into the heart.
original_verse_text: "There are six things the Lord hates, no seven things He detests. haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that kill the innocent, and that plots evil, feet that race to do wrong, a false witness who pours out lies, a person who sows discord among brothers. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging the deceitfulness of our hearts and the wickedness that can lurk within. Help us to see sin as You see it, not just the outward actions, but the hidden motives and desires that offend Your holy nature. Grant us the wisdom to search our hearts, that we may turn from the sins You hate - the proud looks, the lying tongues, the hands that shed innocent blood. May we walk in the light of Your truth, for You alone know the depths of our hearts and will judge us righteously. Amen.
reflection: We need to note that the sin of murder is listed with other sins more subtle and are hard to prove and punish. But we really need to remember God hates all sin, even the ones missed or camouflaged by humans. Another fact to remember is God sees into the heart.
subject: Subtle Sins Seen by God
verse_text: “There are six things the Lord hates, no seven things He detests. haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that kill the innocent, and that plots evil, feet that race to do wrong, a false witness who pours out lies, a person who sows discord among brothers. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with in_

_you; keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple _

_of your eye." _(Pro. 7:1, 2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Keeping God's law is not mere obedience to external commands,

it is a matter of the heart. When we store God's Words within us,

God keeps us from sinning. Life at its fullest comes to those who

fear, love, and trust in God and His commands and promises.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would be sensitive to Your Spirit's guidance

so that I would store up Your Word within my heart. Forgive me

when I stray from Your Word I pray in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Keeping God's law is not mere obedience to external commands, it is a matter of the heart. When we store God's Words within us, God keeps us from sinning. Life at its fullest comes to those who fear, love, and trust in God and His commands and promises.
original_verse_text: "My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with in you; keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple of your eye. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the treasure of Your Word, which You have graciously entrusted to us. Help us to hide Your commands in our hearts, that we may not sin against You. May our love for Your law be our delight, and may we walk in the way of Your statutes, for in keeping them there is great reward. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may fear, love, and trust in You with all our heart. Amen.
reflection: Keeping God's law is not mere obedience to external commands, it is a matter of the heart. When we store God's words within us, God keeps us from sinning. Life at its fullest comes to those who fear, love, and trust in God and His commands and promises.
subject: Delight in God's Commandments
verse_text: “My son, keep my words and treasure up my commandments with in you; keep my commandments and live; keep my teaching as the apple of your eye. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Say to wisdom, "You are my sister," and call insight your intimate_

_friend, to keep you from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress_

_with her smooth words." _(Pro. 7:4, 5)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Once again, wisdom is contrasted with the adulteress. When we keep

intimate company with God's wisdom, we will be kept from adultery

and the other sins of the world.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would never stray from Your wisdom, that

can be found in Your Word. Continue to place a hunger in my heart

for Your Word. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Once again, wisdom is contrasted with the adulteress. When we keep intimate company with God's wisdom, we will be kept from adultery and the other sins of the world.
original_verse_text: "Say to wisdom, "You are my sister, " and call insight your intimate friend, to keep you from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress with her smooth words. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we thank You for the gift of Your wisdom, which guards our hearts and minds from the temptations of this world. Help us to cherish Your wisdom as a dear friend, that we may be kept from the seductive ways of the adulteress and walk in the path of righteousness. May Your wisdom be our constant companion, leading us ever closer to You. Amen.
reflection: Once again, wisdom is contrasted with the adulteress. When we keep intimate company with God's wisdom, we will be kept from adultery and the other sins of the world.
subject: Wisdom Keeps from Adultery
verse_text: “Say to wisdom, “You are my sister, “ and call insight your intimate friend, to keep you from the forbidden woman, from the adulteress with her smooth words. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Listen to me! For I have excellent things to tell you. Everything I
say _

_is right. For I speak the truth and hate every kind of deception.
_(Pro. 8:6, 7)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The strategy for effective living--Begins with--Wisdom from God.

It requires--Moral living--Trusting in God and His Word.

It also requires--Practical application--Acting on God's direction in
daily devotion.

Resulting in--Effective living--Experiencing what God does with our
obedience.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that I would gain a greater wisdom
through

trusting in Your Word. I pray that I would experience Your presences
in

my daily life. AMEN.
original_reflection_text: The strategy for effective living--Begins with--Wisdom from God. It requires--Moral living--Trusting in God and His Word. It also requires--Practical application--Acting on God's direction in daily devotion. Resulting in--Effective living--Experiencing what God does with our obedience.
original_verse_text: "Listen to me! For I have excellent things to tell you. Everything I say is right. For I speak the truth and hate every kind of deception.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, seeking the wisdom that comes from above. Help us to trust in You with all our hearts and not lean on our own understanding. Guide us to acknowledge You in all our ways, that You may direct our paths and lead us to live effectively for Your glory. May we walk in moral uprightness, applying Your Word to our daily lives. We surrender ourselves to Your perfect plan, trusting that You will make our way straight. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: The strategy for effective living--Begins with--Wisdom from God. It requires--Moral living--Trusting in God and His Word. It also requires--Practical application--Acting on God's direction in daily devotion. Resulting in--Effective living--Experiencing what God does with our obedience.
subject: Effective Living Begins with Wisdom
verse_text: “Listen to me! For I have excellent things to tell you. Everything I say is right. For I speak the truth and hate every kind of deception.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"All who fear the Lord will hate evil, That is why I hate pride,_

_arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech." _(Pro. 8:13)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The more people fear and respect God, the more he or she will hate

evil. Love for God and love for sin cannot coexist. Harboring secret

sins means that you are tolerating evil within yourself. Make a clean

break with sin and commit yourself completely to God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that Your Holy Spirit would instill in me godly

judgment, each day so that I would not sin against You. I pray for

godly discernment. .Amen.
original_reflection_text: The more people fear and respect God, the more he or she will hate evil. Love for God and love for sin cannot coexist. Harboring secret sins means that you are tolerating evil within yourself. Make a clean break with sin and commit yourself completely to God.
original_verse_text: "All who fear the Lord will hate evil, That is why I hate pride, arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, seeking to walk in Your ways and turn away from all that displeases You. Help us to truly fear and respect You, that we may hate evil and cling to what is good. Cleanse us from any hidden sins, and grant us the courage to make a clean break from all that separates us from You. May our love for You be the driving force in our lives, that we may experience the blessings and protection that come from living according to Your will. Amen.
reflection: The more people fear and respect God, the more they will hate evil. Love for God and love for sin cannot coexist. Harboring secret sins means that you are tolerating evil within yourself. Make a clean break with sin and commit yourself completely to God.
subject: Embrace God, Reject Evil
verse_text: “All who fear the Lord will hate evil, That is why I hate pride, arrogance, corruption, and perverted speech. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"By me kings reign, and rulers decree what is just; rulers lead with
_

_my help, and nobles, make righteous judgments." _(Pro. 8:15, 16)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Kings--rulers--princes--nobles. Wisdom is a crucial asset for those

who govern. Their JUST government evidences the wisdom of God,

who sets governments in place and uses them for His purpose.

Let us remember to pray for our government officials federal state

and local, that they would seek Godly wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that each of our government officials, including

our president, would seek Godly wisdom, and would spend less

time at name calling, and get on with the business at hand. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Kings--rulers--princes--nobles. Wisdom is a crucial asset for those who govern. Their JUST government evidences the wisdom of God, who sets governments in place and uses them for His purpose. Let us remember to pray for our government officials federal state and local, that they would seek Godly wisdom.
original_verse_text: "By me kings reign, and rulers decree what is just; rulers lead with my help, and nobles, make righteous judgments. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, acknowledging that true wisdom comes from You alone. We lift up our government leaders, federal, state, and local, that they may govern with justice and discernment, guided by the wisdom You so graciously provide. May they seek Your will and use their authority to serve the people according to Your purposes. Grant them the courage to make decisions that honor You and bring about Your kingdom on earth. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: Kings—rulers—princes—nobles. Wisdom is a crucial asset for those who govern. Their just government evidences the wisdom of God, who sets governments in place and uses them for His purpose. Let us remember to pray for our government officials, federal, state, and local, that they would seek Godly wisdom.
subject: Godly Wisdom for Government Leaders
verse_text: “By me kings reign, and rulers decree what is just; rulers lead with my help, and nobles, make righteous judgments. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently _

_will find me." _(Pro. 8:17)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"I love those who love me." _Wisdom is set into the context of an

intimate relationship. The verses second line adds to the thought

of the first, promising that those who love and seek Wisdom will

find her. _Seek_. ._ Find._ Are words used often in Proverbs for
the

quest of wisdom.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, once again I pray for Your Holy Spirit's guidance, I

pray that I would be obedient in following His leading so that I

will grow in wisdom. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "I love those who love me. " Wisdom is set into the context of an intimate relationship. The verses second line adds to the thought of the first, promising that those who love and seek Wisdom will find her. Seek. Find. Are words used often in Proverbs for the quest of wisdom.
original_verse_text: I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently will find me. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before you with grateful hearts, seeking the wisdom that you so graciously offer. Help us to love you and your ways, that we may find the hidden treasures of your truth. Strengthen our resolve to diligently search for your wisdom, that we may grow in understanding and walk in the light of your counsel. May our lives be a reflection of your love and wisdom, that others may be drawn to the riches of knowing you. In Jesus' name, Amen.
reflection: “I love those who love me.“ Wisdom is set into the context of an intimate relationship. The verse's second line adds to the thought of the first, promising that those who love and seek Wisdom will find her. Seek. Find. Are words used often in Proverbs for the quest of wisdom.
subject: Wisdom Loves Those Who Love
verse_text: I love those who love me, and those who seek me diligently will find me. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Riches and honor are with me, enduring wealth and_

_righteousness. My fruit is better than gold, even fine_

_gold, and my yield than choice silver." _(Pro. 8:18, 19)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_"Enduring wealth. fruit. yield. _This agricultural language

accents Wisdom as a renewing resource, promising future

blessings, in contrast with the stagnant wealth of precious

metals and gems.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, as I grow older I thank you for the promise of

a place where there will be no more pain or sorrow for those

who trust and believe in You. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "Enduring wealth. fruit. yield. This agricultural language accents Wisdom as a renewing resource, promising future blessings, in contrast with the stagnant wealth of precious metals and gems.
original_verse_text: "Riches and honor are with me, enduring wealth and righteousness. My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold, and my yield than choice silver. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we give thanks for the gift of Your divine wisdom, which brings enduring wealth and lasting joy. May we seek after this wisdom, which is more precious than gold and silver, that we may walk in Your ways and bear the fruit of righteousness. Guide us by Your Spirit, that we may discern Your will and find true fulfillment in serving You. Amen.
reflection: “Enduring wealth, fruit, yield. This agricultural language accents Wisdom as a renewing resource, promising future blessings, in contrast with the stagnant wealth of precious metals and gems.“
subject: Enduring Wealth's Fruitful Yield
verse_text: “Riches and honor are with me, enduring wealth and righteousness. My fruit is better than gold, even fine gold, and my yield than choice silver. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"I walk in the way of the righteous, in the paths of justice,
granting_

_an inheritance to those who love Me, and filling their treasuries."_

(Pro. 8:20, 21)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"_Way (s) _Used for a "_pattern of behavior or custom." "The way of
the_

_Lord" _is twofold: He punishes sinfulness, but He also show mercy to

the repentant. Jesus describes Himself as the "_way" _in (Jn. 14:6).

_"Granting_ _an inheritance to those who love Me." _This is the
riches that

come to those who follow God's Wisdom, the Christ, are celebrated in

several NT passages. Paul speaks of the rich inheritance of those who

are in Christ (Eph. 13:14)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I thank You for the riches that come to all who except
Christ

as their Lord and Savior. Amen
original_reflection_text: "Way (s) Used for a "pattern of behavior or custom. " "The way of the Lord" is twofold: He punishes sinfulness, but He also show mercy to the repentant. Jesus describes Himself as the "way" in (John 14:6). "Granting an inheritance to those who love Me. " This is the riches that come to those who follow God's Wisdom, the Christ, are celebrated in several NT passages. Paul speaks of the rich inheritance of those who are in Christ (Ephesians 13:14)
original_verse_text: "I walk in the way of the righteous, in the paths of justice, granting an inheritance to those who love Me, and filling their treasuries. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for the ways You have revealed to us through Your Word. Your ways are righteous and true, leading us to the riches of life in Christ. We thank You for the inheritance You have graciously granted to those who love and follow Your Wisdom, the Lord Jesus. May we walk in the way of the Lord, finding our joy and fulfillment in the blessings of being Your beloved children. Amen.
reflection: “Ways used for a pattern of behavior or custom.“ “The way of the Lord“ is twofold: He punishes sinfulness, but He also shows mercy to the repentant. Jesus describes Himself as the “way“ in (John 14:6). “Granting an inheritance to those who love Me.“ This is the riches that come to those who follow God's Wisdom, the Christ, are celebrated in several NT passages. Paul speaks of the rich inheritance of those who are in Christ (Ephesians 1:3-14).
subject: Inherit God's Riches Through Christ
verse_text: “I walk in the way of the righteous, in the paths of justice, granting an inheritance to those who love Me, and filling their treasuries. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His work, _

_the first of His acts of old." _(Pro. 8:22)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Just as Solomon's students were encouraged to acquire

or posses Wisdom, so the Lord possess Wisdom in eternity,

EVEN before His act of creation.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I plead again for greater sensitivity

to attain godly wisdom, I pray this in Jesus name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Just as Solomon's students were encouraged to acquire or posses Wisdom, so the Lord possess Wisdom in eternity, EVEN before His act of creation.
original_verse_text: "The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His work, the first of His acts of old. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we stand in awe of Your eternal wisdom and understanding, which You possessed even before the creation of the world. Your wisdom is the foundation upon which You established the heavens and the earth, and by Your understanding, the depths were broken up and the skies dropped down their dew. We humbly submit ourselves to Your perfect plan and purpose, trusting in the depths of Your eternal wisdom. Guide us, Lord, to walk in Your ways and to seek after the wisdom that comes from You. Amen.
reflection: Just as Solomon's students were encouraged to acquire or possess Wisdom, so the Lord possessed Wisdom in eternity, even before His act of creation.
subject: Eternal Wisdom Precedes Creation
verse_text: “The Lord possessed me at the beginning of His work, the first of His acts of old. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Ages ago I was set up, at the first, before the beginning of the
earth._

(Pro. 8:23)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The words, _set up, here is referring to Wisdom begotten of God._

For Christ as appointed Messiah BEFORE_ _the_ _creation of the world.

In (Jn. 17:5) Jesus refers to this statement when He says: "_Now, _

_Father, bring me into the glory we shared before the world began_."

Before Jesus came to earth, He was ONE with God. At this point

Jesus was asking His Father, to restore Him to His original place

of honor.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord Jesus, I thank You for coming to earth and taking

the punishment I deserved for my sins. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The words, set up, here is referring to Wisdom begotten of God. For Christ as appointed Messiah BEFORE the creation of the world. In (John 17:5) Jesus refers to this statement when He says: "Now, Father, bring me into the glory we shared before the world began. " Before Jesus came to earth, He was ONE with God. At this point Jesus was asking His Father, to restore Him to His original place of honor.
original_verse_text: "Ages ago I was set up, at the first, before the beginning of the earth.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we praise You for Your eternal wisdom and the glory You have shared with Your Son from before the foundation of the world. We marvel at the plan You set in motion, appointing Christ as Messiah even before creation. Lord, we long to behold the glory of Your Son, as He was with You in the beginning, that we may share in the unity and love You have eternally enjoyed. May we walk in the wisdom that flows from Your throne, and find our place in the eternal purposes You have ordained. Amen.
reflection: The words “set up“ here are referring to Wisdom begotten of God. For Christ was appointed Messiah before the creation of the world. In (John 17:5), Jesus refers to this statement when He says: “Now, Father, bring me into the glory we shared before the world began.“ Before Jesus came to earth, He was ONE with God. At this point, Jesus was asking His Father to restore Him to His original place of honor.
subject: Eternal Glory Awaits the Messiah
verse_text: “Ages ago I was set up, at the first, before the beginning of the earth.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When there were no depths I was brought forth,_

_When there were no springs abounding with water."_

(Pro. 8:24)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

This anticipates the N.T. language describing Jesus a "begotten" the

eternal generation of the Son from the Father, before time and space

were created. We need to also understand Wisdom to be eternal, its

clearly not a part of creation. .

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Thank You Lord Jesus, for coming to earth to show us the way to

eternal life and to pay the price for our sins. Amen.
original_reflection_text: This anticipates the N. T. language describing Jesus a "begotten" the eternal generation of the Son from the Father, before time and space were created. We need to also understand Wisdom to be eternal, its clearly not a part of creation. .
original_verse_text: "When there were no depths I was brought forth, When there were no springs abounding with water. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble hearts, marveling at the eternal wisdom and power of Your Son, Jesus Christ. As the Scriptures declare, He was with You before the foundation of the world, the radiance of Your glory and the exact imprint of Your nature. We give thanks that through Him, all things were created and are sustained by Your mighty hand. Lord, grant us wisdom to comprehend the depths of Your eternal plan and to walk in the light of Your Son, our Savior. Amen.
reflection: This anticipates the N.T. language describing Jesus as “begotten,“ the eternal generation of the Son from the Father, before time and space were created. We need to also understand Wisdom to be eternal; it is clearly not a part of creation.
subject: Eternal Generation of the Son
verse_text: “When there were no depths I was brought forth, When there were no springs abounding with water. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"When He established the heavens, when He made3 firm the skies,_

_When He assigned to the sea its limit, then I was beside Him like_

_a master workman." _(Pro. 8:27a, 28a, 29a, 30a)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

It is often said that the O T is revealed in the N T while the N T

is concealed in the OT in other words, what is not entirely clear in

the O T becomes clear in the coming of Jesus the Christ. That is what

has happened in Pro. 8. The NT explicitly states that Jesus is the
one

"In whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. (Col.
2:3)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that as I read Proverbs, I will hear the voice of
the

Redeemer. Amen.
original_reflection_text: It is often said that the O T is revealed in the N T while the N T is concealed in the OT in other words, what is not entirely clear in the O T becomes clear in the coming of Jesus the Christ. That is what has happened in Proverbs 8. The NT explicitly states that Jesus is the one "In whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge. (Colossians 2:3)
original_verse_text: "When He established the heavens, when He made3 firm the skies, When He assigned to the sea its limit, then I was beside Him like a master workman. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we marvel at Your wisdom and power, displayed in the creation of the heavens and the earth. Your Son, Jesus Christ, is the very image of the invisible God, the firstborn over all creation, for in Him all things were created, both in the heavens and on earth. We give thanks that through Christ, all things hold together and find their purpose. Lord, open our eyes to behold the glory of Your Son, the eternal Word by whom all things were made. Amen.
reflection: It is often said that the OT is revealed in the NT, while the NT is concealed in the OT. In other words, what is not entirely clear in the OT becomes clear in the coming of Jesus the Christ. That is what has happened in Proverbs 8. The NT explicitly states that Jesus is the one “In whom are hidden all the treasures of wisdom and knowledge.“ (Colossians 2:3)
subject: Wisdom's Eternal Treasure Revealed
verse_text: “When He established the heavens, when He made3 firm the skies, When He assigned to the sea its limit, then I was beside Him like a master workman. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my_

_gates, waiting beside my doors." _(Pro. 8:34)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

The Lord is our Wisdom. Like Wisdom in ch. 8, Christ calls us from

worldly foolishness, judgments, and death, TO obedience, God's favor,

and abundant life. Christ's eternal nature, His relationship with the

Father, and His work in creation all mark Him as the very wisdom of

God.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord, I pray that I would continue to draw closer to You so that

I would grow in obedience, God's favor, and abundant life. Amen.
original_reflection_text: The Lord is our Wisdom. Like Wisdom in ch. 8, Christ calls us from worldly foolishness, judgments, and death, TO obedience, God's favor, and abundant life. Christ's eternal nature, His relationship with the Father, and His work in creation all mark Him as the very wisdom of God.
original_verse_text: "Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting beside my doors. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking the wisdom that only You can provide. Like Wisdom in Proverbs, we long to hear Your voice, to dwell in Your presence, and to walk in the ways that lead to life. Help us to turn away from the foolishness of this world and instead embrace the eternal wisdom found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. May we delight in the riches of Your wisdom, for they are more precious than gold and silver. Guide us, Lord, that we may live according to Your will and find the abundant life You have promised. Amen.
reflection: The Lord is our Wisdom. Like Wisdom in ch. 8, Christ calls us from worldly foolishness, judgments, and death, to obedience, God's favor, and abundant life. Christ's eternal nature, His relationship with the Father, and His work in creation all mark Him as the very wisdom of God.
subject: Wisdom of God Calls Us
verse_text: “Blessed is the one who listens to me, watching daily at my gates, waiting beside my doors. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"_Leave your simple ways, and live, and walk in the way of

insight." (Pro. 9:6)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

_live _Wisdom promises life to all who share her feast, which

gives life (8:35). the way of Wisdom leads to abundant life.

(Wisdom be the way of Christ)

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

I thank You Lord Jesus that You have made the way which

leads to abundant life----(eternal life). Amen.
original_reflection_text: live Wisdom promises life to all who share her feast, which gives life (8:35). the way of Wisdom leads to abundant life. (Wisdom be the way of Christ)
original_verse_text: "Leave your simple ways, and live, and walk in the way of insight. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking the way of true Wisdom that leads to life abundant. Help us to hold fast to the instruction of Wisdom, for it is our life (Proverbs 4:13). May we forsake the ways of folly and instead feast upon the bountiful table You have prepared, that we may walk the path of righteousness and find the fullness of life in You. Guide us, Lord, that we may live according to the Wisdom found in Your Son, Jesus Christ. Amen.
reflection: Live Wisdom promises life to all who share her feast, which gives life (8:35). The way of Wisdom leads to abundant life. (Wisdom be the way of Christ)
subject: Wisdom's Feast Brings Life
verse_text: “Leave your simple ways, and live, and walk in the way of insight. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the_

_knowledge of the Holy One is insight." _(Pro. 9:10)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

"_Fear of the Lord. .and knowledge"_ Leads to a sense of

sin, which leads to repentance, and thus God bestows His

compassion upon those who are penitent.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

My prayer again today O Lord, is to seek forgiveness for my

every sin. I also pray for the leadership of our country, both

federal, state, and local, that they would seek godly wisdom

in governing this country in accordance with Your will. Amen.
original_reflection_text: "Fear of the Lord. and knowledge" Leads to a sense of sin, which leads to repentance, and thus God bestows His compassion upon those who are penitent.
original_verse_text: "The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight."
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with humble and contrite hearts, acknowledging our need for Your wisdom and understanding. As Your Word declares, the fear of the Lord is the beginning of knowledge, and we long to walk in that reverence for You. Forgive us for the times we have fallen short, and grant us the gift of a broken and contrite spirit, that we may receive Your abundant compassion and grace. May our lives be a testament to Your transformative power. Amen.
reflection: “Fear of the Lord and knowledge“ leads to a sense of sin, which leads to repentance, and thus God bestows His compassion upon those who are penitent.
subject: Wisdom Begins with Fear
verse_text: “The fear of the Lord is the beginning of wisdom, and the knowledge of the Holy One is insight.“

original_content:
-----------------------------------------From:
pastor.sather@charter.net
To:
Cc:
Sent: Saturday April 28 2018 8:28:53PM
Subject: Devo. for Apr. 29

VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"For by Me your days will be multiplied, and years will added to
your_

_life, If you are wise, you are wise for yourself; if you scoff, you
alone_

_will bear it." _(9:11, 12)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

As we saw in 3:1, 2 those who live by Wisdom will be blest with long

life. God gives wisdom, and the wise are blessed. Those who reject

Wisdom's invitation have no one to blame but themselves for the sad

plight of their lives. The wise receive grace's gift, deliverance
from the

way of death. Those on their way with Folly will get what they
deserve

and bear it all alone.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Lord save me when I stray from You. Make me wise to the truth

of Your love. Help me to know you and love You so deeply that in your

life-giving presence I will grow more like You. I pray this in Your
Holy

and Precious name. Amen.
original_reflection_text: As we saw in 3:1, 2 those who live by Wisdom will be blest with long life. God gives wisdom, and the wise are blessed. Those who reject Wisdom's invitation have no one to blame but themselves for the sad plight of their lives. The wise receive grace's gift, deliverance from the way of death. Those on their way with Folly will get what they deserve and bear it all alone.
original_verse_text: Wisdom will multiply your days and add years to your life. If you become wise, you will be the one to benefit. If you scorn wisdom, you will be the one to suffer.
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, seeking the wisdom that comes from above. As Your Word declares, it is You who gives wisdom, and from Your mouth come knowledge and understanding. We humbly ask that You would grant us the discernment to walk the path of righteousness, for in doing so, we may receive the gift of long life and the blessings that come with it. Help us to embrace Your invitation to Wisdom, that we may be delivered from the way of death and the consequences of our own folly. May we never forget that the choice is ours, and that our actions have eternal consequences. In Your name, we pray. Amen.
reflection: As we saw in 3:1-2, those who live by Wisdom will be blessed with long life. God gives wisdom, and the wise are blessed. Those who reject Wisdom's invitation have no one to blame but themselves for the sad plight of their lives. The wise receive grace's gift, deliverance from the way of death. Those on their way with Folly will get what they deserve and bear it all alone.
subject: Wisdom's Blessing: Long Life
verse_text: Wisdom will multiply your days and add years to your life. If you become wise, you will be the one to benefit. If you scorn wisdom, you will be the one to suffer.

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"A wise son makes his father glad, but a foolish son is a_

_sorrow to his mother." _(Pro. 10:1)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Many proverbs connect a son's behavior or character with the

well being of his parents. The good works of Jesus' followers

likewise reflect the glory of their heavenly Father. The question

we need to ask ourselves is, "What does my character reflect?"

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear Heavenly Father, I pray that my behavior would always

reflect the glory of my Lord and Savior Jesus Christ. Amen.
original_reflection_text: Many proverbs connect a son's behavior or character with the well being of his parents. The good works of Jesus' followers likewise reflect the glory of their heavenly Father. The question we need to ask ourselves is, "What does my character reflect?"
original_verse_text: "A wise son makes his father glad, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You with grateful hearts, acknowledging that our actions and character reflect upon Your name. Help us, as Your children, to walk in wisdom and bring joy to those who have nurtured us, just as Your Word instructs. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness, that others may see Your glory through us. Guide us, Lord, to live in a manner that honors You. Amen.
reflection: Many proverbs connect a son's behavior or character with the well-being of his parents. The good works of Jesus' followers likewise reflect the glory of their heavenly Father. The question we need to ask ourselves is, “What does my character reflect?“
subject: Reflecting Your Heavenly Father
verse_text: “A wise son makes his father glad, but a foolish son is a sorrow to his mother. “

original_content:
VERSE FOR TODAY:

_"Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living can_

_save your life." _(Pro. 10:2)

THOUGHT FOR TODAY:

Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by choosing

ill-gotten gain. For example, craving satisfaction, they may

do something that destroys their chances of ever achieving

happiness. God's principles for right living bring lasting

happiness, because they guide us into long-term right

behavior in spite of our ever changing feelings.

PRAYER FOR TODAY:

Dear heavenly Father, I pray for Your guiding principles

for right-living which will guide me into a long-term

right behavior onto a living relationship with Jesus Christ.

Amen.
original_reflection_text: Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by choosing ill-gotten gain. For example, craving satisfaction, they may do something that destroys their chances of ever achieving happiness. God's principles for right living bring lasting happiness, because they guide us into long-term right behavior in spite of our ever changing feelings.
original_verse_text: "Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living can save your life. "
prayer: Heavenly Father, we come before You, acknowledging that true and lasting happiness is found in following Your righteous ways, not in the pursuit of ill-gotten gain. Help us to resist the temptation of short-term pleasures that lead to long-term sorrow. Grant us the wisdom to seek Your will and to walk in the path of obedience, that we may know the joy and peace that comes from living according to Your principles. May our lives be a testament to Your goodness and faithfulness. Amen.
reflection: Some people bring unhappiness on themselves by choosing ill-gotten gain. For example, craving satisfaction, they may do something that destroys their chances of ever achieving happiness. God's principles for right living bring lasting happiness because they guide us into long-term right behavior in spite of our ever-changing feelings.
subject: Lasting Happiness Through Right Behavior
verse_text: “Ill-gotten gain has no lasting value, but right living can save your life. “
